meanings.definition: The process of converting military or government functions to civilian control or ownership.
meanings.sent1: The civilianization of the government agencies helped improve efficiency and transparency.
meanings.sent2: The civilianization of the military bases led to a more peaceful environment.
meanings.sent3: During the civilianization of the army, the soldiers had to learn new ways of operating.
meanings.sent4: The civilianization of the police force brought a fresh perspective to law enforcement.
meanings.sent5: The civilianization of the department was met with mixed reactions from the public.

meanings.definition: The act of replacing military personnel with civilians in a particular role or position.
meanings.sent1: The civilianization of the security team resulted in a safer workplace.
meanings.sent2: The civilianization of the staff at the embassy was a strategic decision.
meanings.sent3: The civilianization of the pilot crew made flying more accessible to everyone.
meanings.sent4: The civilianization of the maintenance department saved costs for the company.
meanings.sent5: The civilianization of the workforce brought new skills and perspectives to the organization.
